sj224.tflp.math

Class BigRational

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • sj224.tflp.math.BigRational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Number>

    public class BigRational
extends java.lang.Number
implements java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Number>
    An implementation of arbitrary-precision rational numbers, a more powerful alternative to java's built-in BigDecimal
    Author:
    Johnathan Waugh
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • BigRational

        public BigRational(java.lang.String val)
        The BigRational representation of the value represented by a string. The string may be formatted as a fraction, an integer percentage, a terminating decimal, or a whole number.
        Parameters:
        val - The string representation of the value.

      • valueOf

        public static BigRational valueOf(java.math.BigDecimal val)
        The BigRational representation of a BigDecimal object.
        Parameters:
        val - The BigDecimal object whose numeric value the returned BigRational represents.
        Returns:

      • doubleValue

        public double doubleValue(int decimalPlaces)
        The double value of this BigRational to a specified number of decimal places. Returns NaN if this BigRational represents the ratio 0/0.
        Parameters:
        decimalPlaces -
        Returns:
        The double value of the represented rational number, truncated to the specified number of decimal places.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int decimalPlaces)
        Returns a string containing a decimal approximation of this BigRational's value. Truncates to a specified number of decimal places.
        Parameters:
        decimalPlaces - The number of decimal places to use
        Returns:
        A string representation as described above
